III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title & (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Section supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
Description perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There have been at least two altercations involving a youth being
spit on by other youths in which the guards did not intervene. The
guards told the youth that the next time youth is bothered to just
hit the youth. The staff reported that youth initiated another fight
by turning their cheek, telling the other youth to hit them. Staff
stated they did a group conversation about behaviors.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 8/6/24.
Complainant reported she did not have any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth A reported on 7/4/24, Youth B drew inappropriate pictures
in his journal, so Youth A became upset. Youth A reported Youth
B spit in his face while he was talking, yelled at him, and told
Youth A to hit him. Youth A reported staff (couldn’t remember
who) intervened by trying to verbally de-escalate the situation and
get in between them. Youth A reported he went to his room to cool
down, but it didn’t work. Youth A reported he took his jumper off,
went back into the pod, and immediately punched Youth B. Youth
A reported Youth B punched him back, and then security and staff
(couldn’t remember who) separated them. Youth A reported no
staff told him to hit Youth B or encouraged them to fight. Youth A
reported he has heard staff (couldn’t remember who) say “[Youth
B] is making our pod too hot because of his behaviors. Someone
should teach him a lesson.” Youth A reported there haven’t been
situations where he’s been spit on by other youth on the pod.
Youth A reported Youth B spits when he talks but hasn’t
intentionally spit on him.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth B reported on 7/4/24, he drew inappropriate pictures in
Youth A’s journal because he thought it would be funny, but Youth
A got angry. Youth B reported Youth A acted like he wanted to
fight him, but staff (couldn’t remember who) intervened by de-
escalating the situation, so Youth A went to his room instead.
Youth B reported shortly after, Youth A came out of his room and
2

punched Youth B. Youth B reported in retaliation, he punched
Youth A. Youth B reported staff and security (couldn’t remember
who) intervened immediately and separated them.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth C reported he was present for the situation on 7/4/24 but
couldn’t remember which staff and security were involved or what
happened.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth D reported Youth A became angry at Youth B because
Youth B drew in Youth A’s journal. Youth D reported Staff 1
immediately got in the middle of Youth A and Youth B to break
them up and de-escalate the situation. Youth D reported Staff 1
also called security to the pod since things were escalated. Youth
D reported Youth A went to his room, but quickly came back out
and hit Youth B. Youth D reported Youth B punched Youth A, and
then Staff 2 and Staff 3 broke them up and put them each in their
rooms to cool off. Youth D reported there were no staff
encouraging Youth A and Youth B to fight.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 7/23/24. CA reported parents/workers are not notified
when youth get in a fight unless it requires a restraint. CA reported
in this situation, Youth A was not restrained, so it wasn’t reported
to his parents or worker. CA reported there was a group
assistance problem-solving meeting to address the peer conflict
after it occurred. CA reported Youth B spits when he talks, but she
hasn’t heard of him intentionally spitting on anyone in the pod.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 9/10/24. Staff 1 reported
she didn’t completely remember the events of the situation.
However, Staff 1 reported she remembered she was the only staff
present when Youth A and Youth B began to verbally escalate, so
she contacted security to request back-up. Staff 1 reported Youth
A and Youth B punching each other happened very quickly, and
by the time she said, “stop, break it up”, and got near them, the
fight was already over. Staff 1 reported additional staff/security
(couldn’t remember who) showed up right after the fight ended.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/8/24.
Staff 2 reported he was stationed in the AB control room when
security was called to assist in Pod D due to an escalated
situation between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 reported he and
another security officer (couldn’t remember who), were at the door
to the pod and saw Youth A and Youth B in each other’s faces.
3

Staff 2 reported as soon as he put his key in to open the pod door,
Youth B looked at the door and Youth A sucker punched Youth B.
Staff 2 reported Youth B immediately punched Youth A back. Staff
2 reported he and the other security officer (couldn’t remember
who), separated Youth A and Youth B to let them breathe, and
then took them to their rooms.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 9/10/24. Staff 3 reported
she was the only staff present at the time, and she called for back-
up as soon as the verbal altercation between Youth A and Youth
B began. Staff 3 reported she went over to Youth A and Youth B
and said, “Stop. Break it up”, and they did. Staff 3 reported each
youth only got 1 punch in, and it happened very quickly after
Youth A came back out into the pod from his room. Staff 3
reported security staff (couldn’t remember who) arrived right after
Youth A and Youth B got done fighting.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 9/9/24. Staff 4 reported he
was not present for the events leading up to the fight and did not
witness the two youth punch each other. Staff 4 reported he came
to the pod after a call for back-up was requested, and when he
entered the pod, he assisted in separating Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 4 reported after Youth A and Youth B were in their respective
rooms, he left the area.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 9/9/24. Supervisor
reported he did not recall the situation and could not provide
details as to what occurred or what he witnessed.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Although the agency has video cameras, the video footage is only
retained for 30 days. The incident took place on 7/4/24 and the
video was asked on 8/8/24, so the video was not available.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Youth A’s medical assessment/progress note dated 7/4/24
notes Youth A had a small abrasion on the left side of his
face. Ice and topical cream provided.
• Unusual Incident Report Summary completed by CA dated
7/5/24 notes the staff/security involved in the incident were
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4 & Supervisor. Report notes Staff 1
attempted to diffuse Youth A and Youth B’s verbal dispute
but was unsuccessful, and they both ignored all directives
given. Report notes after each youth threw a punch, Staff 4,
4

Staff 2, and Supervisor arrived on the pod, and separated
the youth.
• Youth discipline and behavior modification policy states the
facility prohibits cruel and unusual punishment, which
includes verbal abuse, ridicule or humiliation, and youth
shall not be allowed to discipline other youth. It also
outlines situations when verbal de-escalation and/or
physical intervention may be needed, which includes peer-
on-peer violence.
• Unusual and Critical Incidents policy states all employees
are responsible for documenting all unusual incidents (“out
of the ordinary”) involving youth. The facility manager or
shift supervisor must complete a summary documentation
of the incident before the supervisor completes their
workday.
• Youth Supervision policy states staff may never do
anything to jeopardize the safety, care or welfare of youth.
Staff shall not let youth engage in risky or inappropriate
behaviors. Staff shall monitor youth closely to assess the
need to employ the de-escalation and/or agency’s
therapeutic crisis intervention model.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation reviewed, staff followed procedures
by intervening between the youth fighting. All parties stated the
fight was not encouraged or instigated by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
